BiblioData.Title: MICROFLUIDIC DEVICES AND METHODS OF USE IN THE FORMATION AND CONTROL OF NANOREACTORS
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention provides novel microfluidic devices, kits, and methods that are useful for performing high-throughput screening assays and diagnostics. Such diagnostic methods can include emulsifying an aqueous library of compounds with a set of uniquely dyecoded-labeled droplets in an inert fluorocarbon medium, thereby forming an interactor library, emulsifying an aqueous sample from a subject in an inert fluorocarbon medium, wherein said sample contains a compound that will react with at least one interactor molecule from the interactor library, coalescing the emulsions to form a nanoreactor, and screening the nanoreactors for a desirable reaction between the contents of the nanoreactor, herein one or more steps are performed on a microfluidic device, which can include a plurality of electrically addressable, channel bearing fluidic modules integrally arranged on a microfabricated substrate such that a continuous channel is provided for flow of immiscible fluids.

Claims.P: L A method for performing a diagnostic, the method comprising: a) emulsifying an aqueous library of compounds with a set of uniquely dyecoded- labeled droplets in an inert fluorocarbon medium, thereby forming an interactor library; b) emulsifying an aqueous sample from a subject in an inert fluorocarbon medium, wherein said sample contains a compound that will react with at least one interactor molecule from the interactor library; c) coalescing the emulsions prepared in steps (a) and (b) to form a nanoreactor; and d) screening the nanoreactors for a desirable reaction between the contents of the nanoreactor, wherein one or more steps of (a) - (d) are performed on a microfluidic device.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the library of compounds comprises antigens to various human allergens.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the sample from a subject is serum.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein said screening step is performed by fluorescent polarization.
5. The method of claim 1 further comprising quantifying the amount of the compound in the nanoreactor.
6. A kit for performing the method of claim 1 , the kit comprising an emulsion library of compounds, wherein each emulsion has been uniquely labeled.
7. The kit of claim 6, wherein the library of compounds comprises antigens to various human allergens.
8. The kit of claim 6, wherein the label is a liquid label.
9. The kit of claim 8, wherein the liquid label is a quantum dot.
10. A kit for synthesizing a compound from two or more reactive substructures, the kit comprising an emulsion library of reactive substructures, wherein each emulsion has been uniquely labeled.
11. A kit for liquid labeling a library of compounds, the kit comprising an emulsionof unique liquid labels.

12. A kit for sequencing individual exons from individual chromosomes, the kit comprising: a) an emulsion library of specific primer-pairs to an exon and beads that can bind to said primer-pairs; and b) a chromosomal DNA emulsion.
